bibl.title: Letter from [Howard A. Kelly] to Robert E. Noble, October 13, 1922

div1.p: [Kelly] requests information for a new edition of his book, “Walter Reed and Yellow Fever.“

div1.head: Letter from [Howard A. Kelly] to Robert E. Noble, October 13, 1922
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
October 13, 1922.
Friday
Dear General Noble:
div1.p:
I am revising WALTER REED for
a new edition, adding a chapter on General Sternberg
and one on General Gorgas in their relation to the
work.

I wonder if you can tell me
whether the Miss Maas, the trained nurse who died
from the fever at Havana, was bitten by a mosquito
or was inoculated hoping to secure immunization.
I am also puzzled by the spelling of her name; is
it Maas or Mass as in Gorgas' book?

Do you perhaps know whether any
suitable memorial has been erected to Reed either at
Havana or at Panama?

In connection with the chapter
on General Sternberg, I should like to include his
photograph. Can you tell me where I can secure the
finest possible picture of him?

I shall appreciate any information
that you are able to furnish me.
div1.closer:
Faithfully, Brig. Gen. Robert E. Noble
Librarian, Office of the Surgeon General.
